title: Radiohead - No Surprises - Acappella / Acoustic Cover - Gretsch Jim Dandy
description:
Experimenting with the arrangement 

Vocal Mic: Lauten Audio LS-208

Guitar: Gretsch Jim Dandy 10th Fret Parlor Model with Fishman PowerTap Earth Body sensor 

Looper: Donner Circle Looper

Amplifier: Mesa Rectoverb 25, clean channel at 25 watts

Amp Attenuation: Boss Wazacraft Tube Amp expander core

PA Speaker: Bose S-1 (original) 

Video/Audio recorded in Cinematic Mode / Stereo using IPhone 14 Pro Max   Using it‚Äôs internal mics.

title: Whole Lotta Love - Gretsch Deltatone
description:
Experimental looping arrangement of the Willie Dixon song made famous by Led Zeppelin. Modified Gretsch Deltatone Jim Dandy acoustic guitar. Jon Gomm signature pickup system. Neumann MCM 114 clip mic for vocals. 2 Valeton GP-5 multi FX pedals (wet/dry clean / dirty stereo set-up) with TC flashback mini delay on dirty side. Donner circle looper. Mixed on Zoom L6 portable mixer. Audio and video  recorded live / direct on Iphone 14 Pro Max.

This song reminds me of Ravel's Bolero for some reason ;-)

title: The Rolling Stones: You Can't Always Get What You Want
description:
You Can't Always Get What You Want 
Written by Keith Richards and Mick Jagger

Solo Acoustic Guitar Arrangement by William Hogan
Performed by William Hogan 
Film Edited by William Hogan

Technical notes:
Guitar: 2014 Martin 000 RSGT with John Gomm Signature Pickup system.
Guitar Effects: Valeton GP-5 multi effects pedal, TC Electric mini Flashback Delay and Donner Circle Looper.
Mixer-recorder: Zoom L-6, 32 bit float, 48kh
Vocal microphone: Senhieser 865s Condenser mic.
Percussion: LP egg shaker with sound hole mic, guitar body tapping.
DAW:  Reaper

Recorded on Saturday September 20th, 2025, live in one continuous take. Edited in post for brevity. No punch-ins or pitch correction.

All video sourced from Pexels - Will update with credits for creators prior to public release

title: Black Dog

title: Full  Performance - Sheperd‚Äôs Tub Long Valley Caldera - New Years Weekend 2025
description:
Long Valley Caldera is one of the earths largest volcanoes, with a crater that measures over 20 miles long and 11 miles wide. It‚Äôs full of natural hot-springs and creeks.

With Andrew and David Estey-ang‚Äôs encouragement, I set up my busking rig and played for bathers at the Shepard‚Äôs Hot Tub, a natural hotspring near Mammoth Mountain California I like to vist when I‚Äôm in the Eastern Sierra.

I‚Äôve never felt so much love and appreciation from an audience.

Thanks to everyone in attendance that evening. It was truly a special evening and a perfect way to ring in the new year.

Rock on! ü§òüî•ü§ò

title: Hot Tub Rock - Dylan, Tucker, Young, Hendrix, Stones Medley - Fea. Chris King - Mammoth RV Park
Under You - Foo Fighters: Vocal Sketch / Acoustic Arrangement Development
Gallows Pole Sketch - Jim Dandy, Looper - Zep üéà
description:
Working on an acoustic arrangement for ‚ÄúGallows Pole‚Äù a song made (semi) famous by Led Zeppelin on their 3rd album. 

As with so much of Zepplin‚Äôs catalog, ‚ÄúGallows Pole‚Äù is an adaptation of a traditional folk song. In this case, one that‚Äôs been around for centuries:

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Maid_Freed_from_the_Gallows

Of course Zeppelin made it their own, something I try to do with all the songs I cover. The nice thing about traditional songs with anonymous authors that they are public domain.

Therefore, they are open source- and open to interpretation. There‚Äôs no wrong way to play such a song.

This is my initial take on it - a 3 chord ostinato  pattern based on Jimmy Page‚Äôs devilishly difficult sliding 12 string riff. It‚Äôs so hard I can‚Äôt yet sing well when I play it, so I‚Äôve looped it here so I focus on my voice.

I‚Äôm still memorizing the words - so you‚Äôll see me looking down to the left as I manually scroll my ipad lol‚Ä¶

Let me know what you think. üôÇ

description:

Good stuff =) No, I‚Äôm not trying to sound like Stevie Nicks or Fleetwood Mac lol‚Ä¶.

title: Ring of Fire -  With Mauricio Lewak, Bill Hogan, & Kurt - Port Royal Yacht Club, 3-3-23
description:
NO JAMES TAYLOR! Mauricio Lewak (long time James Taylor drummer) jokes as someone in the audience asks:

"What are you going to play?" 

It was a magical night. Alex DeBlanc invited me to join him for the gig. I had no idea Mauricio or Kurt would be there, or that I'd have the opportunity to jam with such gifted muscians. I didn't know any of the songs, and so had to listen, find the key, and try to "git in where I fit in" as the old blues / jazz player saying goes.

As an autistic person, I have difficulty with unstructured social gatherings. Learning to play music opened up such gatherings to me. I've never felt so at ease or appreciated by people than when I've got my guitar in hand.

It's miraculous

You can view an interview with Mauricio conducted  by Ziljan, a famous maker of cymbals and other percussion instruments here - at the Royal Albert Hall in London:

https://youtu.be/VSVDT0UltnY

You can hear him playing on any James Taylor record released over the past decade or so, and at any life performance by Taylor when he's got a full band with him. It was a privledge to jam with Muaricio, and I'm looking forward to the next time =)

title: Knockin' on Heaven's Door -(Re-uploaded for better quality =)
description:
Me (left) and my first perfoming mentor, Bill Bowman (right) jamming through Dylan's "Knockin on Heaven'e Door" in the spring of 2021 on my boat Little Ahi in Redondo Beach. 

The Pandemic seemed never ending, and this song perfectly captured the mood of that day. Our duo project started out as a purely acoustic thing as seen here. Eventually we added drums and amplification, and other muscians sitting in from time to time. I'll always cherish the time I spent playing with Bill and his ragtag underground / outsider South Bay punk band "The Farmers". As an undiagnosed Aspie / Autistic person, I felt at home in The Farmers. I miss playing with him and them. 

I've learned that musical partnerships are fleeting and unpredictable. Like the improvosational music we make together. That's part of the magic of rock, blues, and jazz - they are anarchic, unpredictable artforms Architecture, the first artform I explored is the exact opposite. 

Making music suits me and my sensitive autistic neurology better. I think this clip says it all  =)

A magic evening - I didn't know the song, but somehow...Alex graciously invited guests to play and sing last Friday, and we were joined by Mauricio Lewak (Jackson Brown's drummer)  other songs, but ironically, Mauricio sat out during the ONE Jackson brown song we played that night!

These two muscians joined Alex and me about an hour and half into Alex's Port Royal Yacht Club set. We jammed like this all night. I didn't get their names, but I'll post them here when I do =) 

I still have over 4 hours of footage and audio to color grade, mix, and edit - much more to come...

Music is love

title: Louisiana Voodoo - When The Levee Breaks
description:
"Now I am become death, the destroyer of worlds"  -  Bhagavad-Gita
"Said cryin' won't help ya, prayin' wont do ya no good..." - Memphis Minnie

When The Levee Breaks is an old delta blues song about the Great Mississippi Flood of 1927. It was written by Memphis Minnie and Kansas Joe McCoy in 1929, 42 years later, Led Zeppelin stole it from them and used it as the closing track for Led Zeppelin 4.

Well, to rip off Bono:

 ‚ÄúI‚Äôm stealing it back‚Ä¶.‚Äú
 
It's a very dark song. 
But from death comes life. 

It all worked out great in the end for Minnie and Joe's legacy too. 

Original Version by Mephis Minnie and Kansas Joe: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=swhEa8vuP6U

Recent collaborative / global version led by John Paul Jones, Led Zepplin's bassist. It's stunning: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LH0-WXUFY2k

title: LA Voodoo  -  High and Dry
description:
The best thing that you've had has gone away....

Two jumps in a week,
I bet you think that‚Äôs pretty clever don‚Äôt you boy?
Flying on your motorcycle,
Watching all the ground beneath you drop
You‚Äôd kill yourself for recognition,
Kill yourself to never, ever stop
You broke another mirror,
You‚Äôre turning into something you are not.

Don‚Äôt leave me high, don‚Äôt leave me dry.
Don‚Äôt leave me high, don‚Äôt leave me dry.

Drying up in conversation,
You‚Äôll be the one who cannot talk.
All your insides fall to pieces,
You just sit there wishing you could still make love.
They‚Äôre the ones who‚Äôll hate you
When you think you‚Äôve got the world all sussed out.
They‚Äôre the ones who‚Äôll spit on you,
You‚Äôll be the one screaming out.

Don‚Äôt leave me high, don‚Äôt leave me dry.
Don‚Äôt leave me high, don‚Äôt leave me dry.

It‚Äôs the best thing that you ever had,
The best thing that you ever, ever had.
It‚Äôs the best thing that you ever had,
The best thing that you ever had has gone away

Don‚Äôt leave me high, don‚Äôt leave me dry.
Don‚Äôt leave me high, don‚Äôt leave me dry.
Don‚Äôt leave me,
Don‚Äôt leave me.

title: LA Voodoo - How to Disappear Completely
description:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Just say to yourself:  "I'm not here. This isn't happening..."
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Disassociation

The separation of mind from body when suddenly overwhelmed. Hallmark of trauma - and spiritual transcendence. A dream-like state of being, that seperates us from the terrible and the ordinary.  A portal to other realities and higher states of being, music was always there for me. Magic sanctuary inside the horrific circumstance of autism, childhood and violence. Music's magic lies in it's transcendence. It's good to diassociate from evil. Necessary. It comes at a terrible cost:

The world is never the same after disassociation

We can never go home

Tom Yorke  wrote How to Disappear Completely after suffering an emotional breakdown during the OK Computer tour in 1997. In it's aftermath, he asked REM's Michael Stipe how he dealt with the pressures of touring.

 Stipe responded: 

"Just say to yourself:  "I'm not here. This isn't happening...""

My childhood was steeped in violence.  Emotional, spiritual, and physical violence. I'm autistic. I  disappear completely when violence happens. Maybe this why I find music is so healing. It helps me disappear. Completely

Into the highest love
A love that heals trauma
And everything else
Music is love

I first heard this masterpiece on YouTube 13 years ago. It‚Äôs an absolutely devastating song to perform because of where I have to go emotionally to sing it and play it.

It's said the key to releasing trauma is to re-live it safely. To give the trauma positive meaning and significance as something you overcame rather than something that overcame you. Such transcendence is the highest form of disassociation. The one that opens portals to a better reality. One based on universal love rather than the universal hate  this reality leverages to such disasterous ends. 

It‚Äôs music that saved me and my soul. It is transcendent and magical when you fully devote yourself to it.

Music saves, my freinds 
Music saves

Radiohead performing How to Disappear Completely live:
https://youtu.be/o2-TOiwbro0

The original music video. This is what being autistic felt like to me before I began playing music:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QzpSKfXneZw

title: LA Voodoo - Orphan Girl
description:
This is for all the oprhans out there. 

You are not alone.

Orphan Girl was recorded live on Decemeber 23, 2022 at the Hermosa Beach Farmer's Market. Thanks to everone who's ever encouraged me to keep playing music, came to a show, put money in the kitty, applauded at the end, or just listened.

That's all I've ever wanted out of life.

To be heard

Original song by Gillian Welsh. If you like this song, look her up on your favorite streaming service. She's absolutely amazing. 

Her Website: gillianwelch.com
The original version by Gillian Welch and David Rawlings that inspired me to learn Orphan Girl: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IkS6rgmwwLc

Heartbreaking. Absolutely heartbreaking.

In a good way

title: LA Voodoo: Full Length Concert Film
description:
00:00 Oye Como Va / 08:17 Orphan Girl / 14:01 High and Dry / 21:42 How to Disapear Completely / 29:55 Boy at a Bus Stop / 37:57 Angel From Montgomery / 43:48 Ambient Interlude / 45:58 Fake Plastic Trees / 53:35 Can't You See / 1:00:16 The Weight / 1:06:07 Sympathy For The Devil / 1:12:49 Running to Stand Still / 1:22:02 Free Fallin' / 1:27:13 Knockin' on Heaven's Door / 1:33:54 Running Down a Dream / 1:40:50 When the Levee Breaks / 1:47:44 Love is Blindness / 1:54:34 Europa / 1:56:12 Mi Ritmo

Louisiana Voodoo is magic. 

Making music is how I pray.  I initially titled this  film "Requiem". As time passed I gained a deeper insight into the transformation I underwent giving concert.  The film is full of good omens, magic, and signs. Synchronicities that I cannot explain.

It's dark, beautiful, and healing

May it provide solice to any child of any age who's suffered abuse from any caretaker. 

You are not alone. 

Louisiana Voodoo was recorded live Decemeber 23, 2022 at the Hermosa Beach Farmer's Market. Many thanks to Nancy Jones for managing the event, and for helping me get the sound right for the vendors and crowd. Big thanks to David Carrol for arranging this gig for me, and for his mentorship and support. Thank you Saba, for standing beside me through the darkest days of my life, and for being there for me ever since. You were the first person to encourge me to sing my songs. Thanks to everone who's ever encouraged me to play my guitar, or who came to a show, put money in the kitty, applauded at the end,  or just sat and listened to me play.

That's all I've ever wanted out of life.

To be heard

title: Farmer's market gig highlights - Hermosa Beach, September 2022
description:
Highlights from my Hermosa Beach Farmer's Market gig Friday September 16th 2022. Great afternoon to sit outside and make music for the locals. I was sitting in for David Caroll the regular performer. Always enjoy the relaxed  setting and good vibes.

=)

title: LA Voodoo - Oye Como Va
description:
Recorded on Sunday Februray 6th, 2022 at Pier Plaza Hermosa Beach. 

I developed my initial solo performance chops through busking. Busking is scary. Especially solo busking. You are an univited performer.  You set-up alone and perform music in public places with hundreds of people ignoring you. At it's worst, your efforts are met with hostility and abuse. At it's best people applaud, thank you profusely, and give generously to you.

I do it despite the challenges. There's freedom in it.  I think of myself as a bird perching and singinging it's song to brighten up jarring urban soundscapes. I see the money people give me as certificates of appreciation, and am reluctant to spend it.

If something I want to do scares me, I try not to let fear stop me. Rather, I see fear as a call to action, and seek to master it. A funny thing happens when you approach fear like this: The more you do it, the less frightening it becomes. Performing music is always a little bit scary for me.

It's much easier now that I've baptized myself in the busking fire.

=)
